chunks.text: Docker is a containerization platform that packages applications and their dependencies into containers. Containers are lightweight, portable, and ensure consistency across different environments.
Kubernetes is an open-source container orchestration platform. It automates deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications across clusters of hosts.
CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) automates code integration, testing, and deployment. Popular tools include Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, and CircleCI.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) manages infrastructure through code rather than manual processes. Tools like Terraform, Ansible, and CloudFormation enable version-controlled infrastructure.
Docker Compose is a tool for defining and running multi-container Docker applications. You define services in a YAML file and can start all services with a single command.
Linux file permissions use read (r), write (w), and execute (x) for owner, group, and others. Use chmod to change permissions (e.g., chmod 755 file.sh).
systemctl is used to manage systemd services. Common commands: systemctl start/stop/restart/status service-name, systemctl enable/disable service-name for boot configuration.
SSH (Secure Shell) provides encrypted remote access to servers. Use ssh user@host to connect, and ssh-keygen to generate key pairs for passwordless authentication.
Cron jobs automate recurring tasks. Edit crontab with 'crontab -e'. Format: minute hour day month weekday command. Example: '0 2 * * * /backup.sh' runs daily at 2 AM.
Process management commands: ps aux (list processes), top/htop (monitor resources), kill PID (terminate process), killall name (kill by name), bg/fg (background/foreground).
Python virtual environments isolate project dependencies. Create with 'python -m venv venv', activate with 'source venv/bin/activate' (Linux/Mac) or 'venv\Scripts\activate' (Windows).
FastAPI is a modern Python web framework for building APIs. Features include automatic OpenAPI docs, async support, type hints validation, and high performance comparable to NodeJS.
List comprehensions provide concise syntax for creating lists: [x*2 for x in range(10) if x%2==0] creates [0, 4, 8, 12, 16]. Similar syntax works for dict/set comprehensions.
Python decorators modify function behavior. Syntax: @decorator_name before function definition. Common uses: @staticmethod, @classmethod, @property, and custom decorators for logging/timing.
Async/await in Python enables concurrent programming. Use 'async def' for coroutines, 'await' for async calls, and asyncio.run() or asyncio.gather() to execute async functions.
Transformers revolutionized NLP through attention mechanisms. They enable models to weigh the importance of different parts of input, enabling better context understanding than RNNs.
BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) uses masked language modeling to pre-train on large text corpora, then fine-tunes for specific NLP tasks.
GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer) is an autoregressive language model trained to predict the next token. GPT-4 and Claude are examples of large language models based on this architecture.
Fine-tuning adapts pre-trained models to specific tasks. Methods include full fine-tuning, LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation), and prompt tuning. LoRA is memory-efficient for large models.
PyTorch is a deep learning framework with dynamic computation graphs. Key features: autograd for automatic differentiation, nn.Module for model building, DataLoader for data handling.
Embeddings map discrete data (words, items) to continuous vector spaces. Word2Vec, GloVe, and transformer-based embeddings capture semantic relationships between entities.
RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) combines retrieval systems with LLMs. It retrieves relevant documents and provides them as context to improve generation accuracy and reduce hallucinations.
Vector databases like FAISS, Pinecone, and Weaviate enable efficient similarity search over embeddings. Essential for RAG systems and semantic search applications.
Model serving frameworks like TorchServe, TensorFlow Serving, and Triton enable production deployment of ML models with REST/gRPC APIs, batching, and monitoring.
MLflow tracks experiments, manages models, and handles deployment. It provides logging APIs for parameters, metrics, and artifacts across different ML frameworks.
Model monitoring tracks model performance in production. Key metrics: prediction drift, data drift, model accuracy over time. Tools include Evidently AI, WhyLabs, and custom dashboards.
Feature stores (Feast, Tecton) centralize feature engineering and serving. They ensure consistency between training and inference features, and enable feature reuse across models.
A/B testing for ML models compares two model versions in production. Use statistical tests to determine which performs better before full rollout.
OWASP Top 10 identifies critical web security risks: Injection, Broken Auth, Sensitive Data Exposure, XXE, Broken Access Control, Security Misconfiguration, XSS, Insecure Deserialization, etc.
SQL Injection occurs when user input is concatenated directly into SQL queries. Prevent using parameterized queries or ORMs. Never trust user input.
JWT (JSON Web Tokens) secure API authentication. Structure: header.payload.signature. Always verify signatures, use HTTPS, set short expiration times, and store securely.
HTTPS uses TLS/SSL to encrypt HTTP traffic. Always use HTTPS in production. Let's Encrypt provides free SSL certificates. Configure with strong cipher suites and TLS 1.2+.
Environment variables store secrets securely. Never commit .env files to git. Use secret managers like AWS Secrets Manager, HashiCorp Vault, or Docker secrets in production.
Nginx is a high-performance web server and reverse proxy. Use it for load balancing, SSL termination, serving static files, and proxying to application servers.
Redis is an in-memory data store used for caching, session storage, pub/sub messaging, and real-time analytics. Supports strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets.
PostgreSQL is an advanced open-source relational database. Features include ACID compliance, JSONB support, full-text search, and excellent performance for complex queries.
Firewall management with ufw (Ubuntu): 'sudo ufw enable', 'sudo ufw allow 22', 'sudo ufw deny 80', 'sudo ufw status'. Simple interface for iptables configuration.
Log management: journalctl for systemd logs, tail -f for real-time monitoring, logrotate for log rotation. Store logs in /var/log/, use centralized logging in production.
Pydantic validates data using Python type hints. Define models with field types, get automatic validation, serialization, and IDE support. Perfect for API data validation.
Python testing with pytest: Write test functions starting with 'test_', use fixtures for setup, assert for validation, and parametrize for multiple test cases.
Context managers with 'with' statement ensure resource cleanup. Use for files, database connections, locks. Create custom with __enter__ and __exit__ methods.
Attention mechanisms allow models to focus on relevant parts of input. Self-attention in transformers computes attention scores between all tokens in a sequence.
Transfer learning uses pre-trained models as starting points for new tasks. Common in computer vision (ImageNet models) and NLP (BERT, GPT). Reduces training time and data requirements.
GitOps uses Git as single source of truth for infrastructure and applications. Tools like ArgoCD and Flux CD automate deployments based on Git repository changes.
Prometheus monitors and alerts for cloud-native applications. It scrapes metrics from targets, stores time-series data, and supports PromQL for querying. Works well with Grafana.
Helm is Kubernetes package manager. Charts are packages of pre-configured K8s resources. Use 'helm install', 'helm upgrade', 'helm rollback' for managing releases.
Service mesh (Istio, Linkerd) provides observability, security, and traffic management for microservices without changing application code. Handles service-to-service communication.
Load balancers distribute traffic across servers. Layer 4 (transport layer) balances TCP/UDP, Layer 7 (application layer) balances HTTP/HTTPS with content-based routing.
Blue-green deployment runs two identical environments. Blue serves production, green is new version. Switch traffic when green is validated. Enables instant rollback.
Canary deployments gradually roll out changes to a small subset of users before full deployment. Monitor metrics to detect issues early and rollback if needed.
ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana (ELK) stack centralizes logging. Logstash collects logs, Elasticsearch stores/indexes, Kibana visualizes. Alternative: EFK (Fluentd instead of Logstash).
Container registries store Docker images. Docker Hub is public, use private registries (ECR, GCR, Harbor) for production. Always scan images for vulnerabilities.
Vault by HashiCorp manages secrets and encrypts data. It provides dynamic secrets, data encryption, identity-based access, and detailed audit logs.
API Gateway routes requests to microservices, handles authentication, rate limiting, request transformation, and monitoring. Examples: Kong, AWS API Gateway, Nginx.
Health checks verify service availability. Liveness checks detect if app is running, readiness checks if it can serve traffic. K8s uses these for pod management.
Find command searches files: 'find /path -name '*.py' -type f -mtime -7' finds Python files modified in last 7 days. Combine with -exec for actions on results.
Grep searches text: 'grep -r 'pattern' /path' searches recursively. Use -i for case-insensitive, -v to invert match, -n for line numbers, -A/-B for context lines.
Disk usage commands: 'df -h' shows filesystem usage, 'du -sh *' shows directory sizes, 'ncdu' provides interactive view. Monitor to prevent disk full issues.
Network troubleshooting: 'ping' tests connectivity, 'traceroute' shows packet path, 'netstat -tuln' lists listening ports, 'ss' is modern alternative to netstat.
Package management on Debian/Ubuntu: 'apt update' refreshes package list, 'apt install' installs packages, 'apt upgrade' updates packages, 'apt autoremove' removes unused dependencies.
Environment variables: 'export VAR=value' sets variable, 'echo $VAR' displays value, add to ~/.bashrc for persistence. Use 'env' to list all variables.
Symbolic links: 'ln -s /path/to/original /path/to/link' creates symlink. Useful for version management, config files, and aliasing paths.
User management: 'useradd' creates users, 'usermod' modifies, 'userdel' deletes, 'passwd' changes passwords, 'groups' shows user groups, 'sudo' grants elevated privileges.
Generators use 'yield' to produce values lazily, saving memory. Generator expressions: (x*2 for x in range(1000000)) creates iterator without storing all values.
Dataclasses simplify class creation: '@dataclass' decorator auto-generates __init__, __repr__, __eq__. Supports default values, type hints, and frozen instances.
Type hints improve code clarity and enable static analysis: 'def greet(name: str) -> str:'. Use Optional, Union, List, Dict from typing module.
Error handling: try/except catches exceptions, else runs if no exception, finally always executes. Use specific exceptions, avoid bare except. raise for custom errors.
Logging module: import logging, logging.basicConfig() configures, logging.debug/info/warning/error/critical() log messages. Better than print for production code.
Collections module provides specialized data structures: Counter (counting hashable objects), defaultdict (default values), OrderedDict (insertion order), deque (double-ended queue).
Pathlib for file operations: from pathlib import Path. Object-oriented file handling: Path('file.txt').read_text(), .write_text(), .exists(), .mkdir(), .glob().
F-strings format strings: f'Hello {name}, you are {age} years old'. Supports expressions: f'{value:.2f}', f'{today:%Y-%m-%d}'. Faster than .format() or %.
Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) excel at image tasks. Key layers: Conv2D (feature extraction), MaxPooling (dimensionality reduction), Flatten, Dense (classification).
Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) process sequential data. LSTM and GRU variants solve vanishing gradient problem. Used for time series, text, before transformers dominated NLP.
Reinforcement Learning: agent learns by interacting with environment, receives rewards/penalties. Q-learning, PPO, SAC are popular algorithms. Used in games, robotics.
Batch normalization normalizes layer inputs during training, stabilizes learning and enables higher learning rates. Apply after linear/conv layers, before activation.
Dropout prevents overfitting by randomly dropping neurons during training. Set rate (0.2-0.5), disable during inference. Simple but effective regularization technique.
Learning rate scheduling adjusts LR during training. Strategies: step decay, exponential decay, cosine annealing, warmup. Crucial for convergence and avoiding local minima.
Data augmentation artificially increases training data diversity. Images: rotation, flip, crop, color jittering. Text: back-translation, synonym replacement, paraphrasing.
Gradient descent optimizers: SGD (simple), Adam (adaptive, popular), RMSprop, AdaGrad. Adam combines momentum and adaptive learning rates, good default choice.
Model versioning tracks model changes over time. Use semantic versioning (major.minor.patch), store metadata (metrics, hyperparameters), link to training data version.
Data versioning with DVC (Data Version Control) tracks datasets and models with Git-like interface. Store large files externally, version in Git. Enables reproducibility.
Model registry centralizes model storage, versioning, and deployment. Features: model lineage, staging (dev/staging/prod), approval workflows, rollback capabilities.
CI/CD for ML: automate training, testing, validation, and deployment. Test data quality, model performance, API endpoints. Use Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI.
Model explainability: SHAP and LIME explain individual predictions, feature importance shows global patterns. Essential for trust, debugging, and regulatory compliance.
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) injects malicious scripts into web pages. Prevent by sanitizing user input, escaping output, using Content Security Policy (CSP) headers.
Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) tricks users into executing unwanted actions. Prevent with CSRF tokens, SameSite cookies, checking Referer header.
Password hashing: never store plain passwords. Use bcrypt, Argon2, or PBKDF2 with salt. Hash is one-way, verify by hashing input and comparing. Set appropriate work factor.
Rate limiting prevents abuse and DoS attacks. Implement at API level (requests per IP/user), use Redis for distributed systems, return 429 status when exceeded.
Input validation: whitelist valid inputs rather than blacklist bad ones, validate data type/format/length, never trust client-side validation alone.
